title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.11 - Off-airport parking operators
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.11 - Off-airport parking operators

State Regulations
(a) General system. Off-airport parking
operators under access permit with the NFTA shall have the nonexclusive
privilege to use and have access to the airport roadways and public vehicular
areas for and in connection with the operation of transporting airport
passengers and their baggage between operator's off-airport parking lot and the
airport. Under no circumstances shall the off-airport parking operator
transport passengers other than those utilizing its off-airport parking
service. Such operators have the privilege of utilizing loading/unloading areas
as designated by the airport manager. The off-airport parking operator may
cause a direct line telephone service to be installed between its off-airport
parking facility and the airport, and pay the appropriate charges, and it may
indicate the location of said telephone service in the terminal buildings by an
appropriate sign or signs. (b) Rules
applicable to off-airport parking operator. (1)

Vehicle appearance and running condition. All vehicles shall be kept clean and in first class running
condition. (2)

Unauthorized
parking. Drivers of off-airport parking operators' vehicles shall not park in
areas other than public parking areas. (3)

Solicitation. Off-airport parking
operators, or any driver or employee of such operators shall, not engage in
solicitation at the airport or in any way collaborate with or encourage any
other person to solicit business at the airport on such operator's
behalf. (4)

Improper conduct. Off-airport parking operators' drivers or employees of operator shall not
engage in boisterous conversations, profanity, or fighting at the airport, nor
shall they provide misleading information concerning other ground
transportation services. (5)

Vehicle requirements. Each vehicle shall at all times meet all requirements
imposed by the New York State Departments of Transportation and Motor Vehicles, in addition to all other applicable State, city and other local
ordinances. (c) Fees and
charges. As set forth in the airport tariff as approved by the NFTA Board of

Commissioners. Notes

1160.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
